title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente, then drain.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and mix in the grated Parmesan cheese.
Fry the pancetta in a pan until crisp. Add garlic and cook briefly.
Add the hot spaghetti to the pan and toss to coat in the pancetta fat.
Remove from heat and mix in the egg and cheese mixture quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy.

instructions: Marinate the chicken in yogurt, garam masala, paprika, salt, and pepper for at least 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked through and set aside.
In a pan, melt butter and sauté onions until soft. Add garlic and ginger, cooking until fragrant.
Add the canned tomatoes and simmer until thickened.
Stir in the cream and cooked chicken, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy dish with mixed vegetables tossed in a savory sauce.

ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add the broccoli, bell pepper, carrot, and zucchini, and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil in a small bowl.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir to coat evenly.
Add the cornstarch slurry and cook until the sauce thickens slightly.
Serve immediately over rice or noodles.

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: Tender beef cooked in a creamy mushroom sauce served over noodles.

instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and cook beef strips until browned. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onions and mushrooms in the same pan until soft.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and cook for 1 minute.
Gradually add beef stock, stirring constantly, and bring to a simmer.
Stir in sour cream and add the cooked beef back to the pan. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot over egg noodles.
